intro: Anthyllis jancheniana, commonly known as the Canary Islands broom, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showing a preference for well-drained soils. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. Anthyllis jancheniana is adapted to the arid and windy conditions of its native habitat, making it a resilient species in its ecological niche.
